Initial release.

Added proxy times for various reassembly actions and design features. Over-reliance on adhesives is now directly penalized due to added time for cleaning, prepping, and bonding, the need for additional tools/fixtures, the need for consumables/supplies, and increased possibility of user frustration/error. Devices that use adhesives but can be reliably re-assembled by other means (i.e. reusable fasteners) receive a reduced penalty.
Refined proxy times associated with various actions, and incorporated new actions.
Added criteria for repairability scoring of desktop keyboards.
Refined scoring model for laptops, where disassembly/reassembly proxy times specific to I/O ports repair procedures are replaced with a simple modularity score.

Incorporated a gating function for full credit on documentation and parts availability criteria. Maximum points are reserved for devices which can be readily identified (model number, service tag, etc.) in a non-working state, making it straightforward to find compatible parts and instructions.
Refined scoring ranges for various device categories.
Finalized and incorporated scoring for availability of replacement parts directly from the OEM (or from an endorsed third party, linked from the OEM's support website.

Refined the scoring calculation for documentation. Criteria for full credit include: repair documentation must be free and publicly available from the OEM support website (or linked therefrom); no registration requirement; presence of tools lists, parts lists with part numbers (or other means of checking compatibility), exploded diagram(s), troubleshooting procedures, schematics, and service procedures for all priority parts.
Incorporated weighted penalties for various parts pairing scenarios into scoring model.
Refined scoring penalty for parts pairing, with additional categories.
Refined proxy times for various degluing actions.
Refined scoring criteria for tablets, and formalized scoring criteria for foldables under the existing smartphone scoring framework.
Added actions and associated proxy times for additional tablet design features.
Revised documentation scoring criteria so that a hardware troubleshooting section is required for full credit.
Formalized and refined scoring criteria for smartwatches and wireless earbuds.
Added actions and associated proxy times for additional wearables design features.
Revised documentation scoring criteria, with more specific guidance for individually scored repair procedures.
Formalized and refined scoring criteria for e-readers as a separate product group from tablets.
Added actions and associated proxy times for additional e-reader design features.
Refined scoring criteria for schematics based on feedback from board-level repair professionals.
Added new tools and adjusted tool categorizations and scaling factors.
Removed/replaced deprecated actions and prioritized actions and proxy times associated with specific hardware design features.
Refined internal definitions and guidance for numerous scoring criteria for greater consistency and ease of use.
Formalized and refined scoring criteria and product group classification for game consoles (handheld).
Adjusted tool multipliers for heat sources.
